answers.answer: No the horror stories are not always true. I was induced with my first, had zero complications, no c section, and labor was only a few hours not days. I'm going to be induced with this one here on the 18th too. Your doctor is simply looking out for what is best for you and the baby. The swelling and sky high bp is far from good for either of you, I wouldn't risk waiting it out.

Remember that lots of woman get induced as a last resort when they go over due and it gets to that point where its safer to get baby out then to risk the placenta getting old... so on that note it does make sense that inductions can lead to csections as there may have been a reason that was preventing labor from occuring to begin with..... like for example with me i was induced and it was aweful BUT my daughter was face up and head arched back, she never dropped and was never going to(stuck and pressing on my spine)... its that simple so i was pre marked as a cesection before i even started (if i had known that earlier it would have been nice lol) but my point is some babies are too big or are in a bad position where they dont drop or whatever and thats why labor doesnt start, so the induction is started and fails... There are lots of mommas out there that get induced and have awesome results and you cant focus on the bad.... there is always a risk to having a csection and they can occur with natural labor as well... if your dr is concerned about your BP then you do have to add that into if you choose to get induced or not... bt dont listen to those stories and really thats nice of them to share them with you at this time!?

I complely agree with lesley27. Your doc wants whats best for you and baby. My neighbor was induced and her labour lasted 36hrs but they refused to break her water, she had her daughter 5hrs after she made them break her water. For the most part being induced isnt bad at all, it really depends on your body and psin tolerence which is the same for natural birth

I was induced with my first went in at 5am at a 3cm and started pitocin right away didnt feel any contrations tell 11am and they cam in at 1 I was a 5 and broke my water and five mins later was haveing him!! it went faster than I expected and didnt hurt that bad cuz I didnt get and epidural ether!!

I think it depends on how labour ready your body already is. If you go in with no signs of dilation or thinning out then I think it's going to take longer and it'll be much more difficult to start up.It's different for everyone. Maybe your doc doesn't want it to turn into preeclampsia?
Oh I forgot to put hes a healthy happy four year old this year!!

My BP was so high at an appt suddenly they put me right in labor and delivery to monitor it.  My blood work was good and I had no protein or swelling, but they still called it preeclampsia.  That night the Dr. decided to induce, I was 2cm and 70%.  5 hours after the pitocin was started at a low dose Leah was born. I was allowed out of bed on the birthing ball and to walk around as far as the monitors would let me unless my BP kept going up.   She is 3 weeks tomorrow and I am still waiting for my BP to go down to my normal baseline of 100/60.High BP can lead to stroke or things like compromised blood flow to the fetus, even if it's not technically preeclampsia.

My daughter is two weeks old today. I got induced the morning of june25th around 9am and had her by csection june26th at 335pm. I was induced a wk early because of low fluid and I had cholestasis (a pregnancy condition only cured by delivery ). I never got past 3cm n 80% effaced because my baby wasn't tolerating the pitocin.  Everytime they raised the dose her heart rate dropped.  They also put cytotec on my cervix and a Foley bulb and that also was no help. But no matter if you go into labor naturally or induced there's always a risk of csection its really up to ur body and baby! Lol. My baby was 7lbs9oz 20inches and she is healthy :)

question: So I had my Dr apt today & because of swelling & my blood pressure keeps going up hen down she wants to induce me Monday. I'm excited but now that ny family knows I've heard nothing but horror stories about prolonged labor for days after getting induced & having to have csections...which I DO not want....should I hold off or just go through with it! I am miserable but I still have a week left & I don't have preeclamsia or protein in my urine....
title: is getting induced bad?
